snippet: Ministers are working throughout the year, and congregational buildings offer services year-round.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column on schedule shift among Unitarian churches, which normally take extended breaks from the middle of June through Labor Day and now seem to be operating full time through the summer; ministers cite varied reasons for the change, some as mundane as recruitment and others as profound as a shift in ministry away from the role of public intellectual and toward a helping profession.
lead_paragraph: Ministers are working throughout the year, and congregational buildings offer services year-round.

headline.print_headline: Unitarians Break With Tradition of Extended Time Off in Summer
headline.seo: Unitarians Shift Away From Extended Time Off in Summers
